translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of Northern Liang and India, Dharmakṣema

source_sentence: 檀波羅蜜品第五之三
translation: The Fifth Third of the Chapter of the Sutra of the Great Perfection of Wisdom

source_sentence: 佛告寂意菩薩：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Silent Will, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 其後復過無量無邊阿僧祇劫，此界轉名選擇諸惡。
translation: After that, there's another incalculably long incalculably long eon, and this realm becomes known as the selection of evils.

source_sentence: 爾時大劫名善等蓋，世亦五濁。
translation: At that point, the great eon is called the good and equal cap, and the world is also five times defiled.

source_sentence: 東方去此五十四天下，彼閻浮提名盧婆羅。
translation: Fifty-four worlds away from here in the east, that Jambudvīpa nominates Rāvilvā.

source_sentence: 以願力故，生於彼中作轉輪聖王，主四天下，號虛空淨，教諸眾生安住十善及三乘中。
translation: Because of the power of his vow, he was born there as a wheel-turning sage king who presides over four worlds and is called Ākāśapratiṣṭhita, teaching sentient beings to abide among the ten good qualities and the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 我於爾時布施一切無所分別，是時多有無量乞兒來，從我乞種種珍寶、金銀、琉璃、頗梨、錢貨、青琉璃珠、大青琉璃、火珠摩尼，所有珍寶少不足言，乞者無量，我於是時即問大臣：『如是珍寶從何處生？』
translation: At the time I was giving generously to all without discrimination, measureless beggars came begging for various treasures from me, including gold and silver, lapis lazuli, pāri, money and goods, blue lapis lazuli beads, large blue lapis lazuli, and fire-jeweled maṇi, all of which were few in number and numberless in number.

source_sentence: 大臣答言：『是諸龍王之所示現，雖有此寶惟供聖王，不能廣及如是乞者。』
translation: The minister replied, 'Although this treasure is shown to the noble king by the dragons, it couldn't reach as far as such a beggar.'

source_sentence: 「我於爾時作大誓願：『若我未來於五濁中，厚重煩惱，人壽百歲，必定成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，所願成就得己利者，作大龍王，示現種種珍寶之藏，於此選擇諸惡世界，在在處處四天下中，於一一天下七返受身，一一身中，示現無量百千萬億那由他等珍寶之藏，一一寶藏縱廣正等一千由旬，各各充滿種種珍寶，如上所說給施眾生。
translation: "At the time, I made a great vow, 'If I were to live a hundred years in the future with five turbidities and heavy afflictions, I would surely achieve unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and I would attain my own goal and become a great dragon king who would reveal a treasure house of various treasures and select the evil worlds, going from place to place in each of the four worlds, returning seven times to receive the body under each world, and revealing in each body a treasure house of measureless hundreds of thousands of trillions of nayutas of treasure, each treasure house measuring exactly 1,000 leagues in length and breadth, each filled with various treasures that I would give to sentient beings as described above.'

source_sentence: 如我在此一世界中精勤用意，如是次第遍十方如恒河沙等五濁惡世無佛國土，於一一佛土一一天下七返受身，乃至如上所說。』
translation: As I have diligently applied myself in this one world, I have thus sequentially traversed the five turbid and unwholesome worlds and no buddha-lands in the ten directions like the sands of the Ganges, and in each buddha-land under each world I have returned seven times to receive the body, even as described above."

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我作如是善願。
translation: I made this good vow.

source_sentence: 爾時天人有百千億，在虛空中，雨種種華而讚我言：『善哉！
translation: At the time, there were a hundred thousand billion gods and humans in the sky, raining seeds and flowers, praising me and saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 一切布施，汝今已得，如心所願。』
translation: You have now attained all almsgiving, just as your heart desires.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾聞虛空淨王，諸天作字，號一切施，聞是事已，各各相謂：『我等今者應往乞求難捨之物，若能捨者，可得名為一切布施。
translation: It was then that the crowd heard that the pure king of space and the gods had created a word that was called all almsgiving, and after hearing this, they each said to one another, 'Now, we should go beg for things that are difficult to dispose of; if we can dispose of them, we can be called all almsgiving.

source_sentence: 如其不能，何得稱為一切施也？』
translation: If we can't, how can we be called all-bestowing?'

source_sentence: 是時諸人各各從王，乞索後宮夫人、婇女及兒息等。
translation: Each of those people then begged the king for a wife, a woman, and a child to take a rest in the harem.

source_sentence: 時轉輪王聞是事已，心大歡喜，隨其所索，悉皆與之。
translation: When the wheel-turning king heard about this, his heart rejoiced, and he gave them all whatever they asked for.

source_sentence: 是時諸人復更相謂：『如是妻子皆是易捨，非難事也。
translation: Those people then also said to each other, 'Such wives are easy to get rid of, not difficult things.

source_sentence: 今當從王乞身支節，若能捨者，真可得名能捨一切。』
translation: Now, we will ask the king for a personal limb, and if we can abandon it, we can truly be called able to abandon all of them.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，諸人往大王所，於是眾中，有乞兒，字青光明，受持狗戒，向轉輪王作如是言：『大王若是一切施者，唯願施我此閻浮提。』
translation: "It was then that the people went to the great king, and among them was a beggar, whose name was Qingmingming, who had received the dog precepts and said to the wheel-turning king, 'Great king, if you are a donor of all things, only give me this Yambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 我時聞已，心大歡喜，尋以香水洗浴其人，令著柔軟上妙衣服，以水灌頂，紹聖王位，持閻浮提即以施之。
translation: When I heard that, I rejoiced greatly, so I washed him with perfume, dressed him in soft, fine clothing, consecrated him with water, assumed the position of sage king, and gave him the Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 復作是願：『如我以此閻浮提施，是因緣故，成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Again, he made this vow: 'If I give this offering of Jambudvī, this will be the cause and condition for achieving unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 所願成就得己利者，是閻浮提所有人民，皆當承順奉敬此人以為王者。
translation: When that vow is accomplished, all the people of Jambudvīpa will obey and venerate that person as king.

source_sentence: 復令此人壽命無量，作轉輪王。
translation: Also, that person's life will be limitless, and he'll become a wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 我成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已，當與授記一生當得補佛之處。』
translation: After I achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, I'll be given a prediction that I'll be reborn as a buddha for a lifetime.'

source_sentence: 「有婆羅門名曰盧志，復來從我乞其兩足。
translation: "There was a Brāhmaṇa named Ruzhi who came back to beg for his two feet from me.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即持利刀，自斷二足，持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世具足當得無上戒足。』
translation: When I heard that, my heart rejoiced, so I took a sharp knife, cut off my own two feet, gave them to him, and after giving them to him, I vowed, 'May I be perfected in the next life and will attain the unsurpassed feet of morality.'

source_sentence: 有婆羅門，名曰牙，復來從我乞索二目。
translation: A Brāhmaṇa named Teeth came back to me begging for two eyes.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即挑二目持以與之，施已發願：『願我來世當得具足無上五眼。』
translation: When I heard that, my heart rejoiced, so I picked them up and gave them the two eyes, and after giving them to him, I vowed, 'May I attain the unsurpassed five eyes in the next life.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有婆羅門，名淨堅牢，復來從我乞索二耳。
translation: Not long after that, a Brāhmaṇa named Jingjianluo came back to me begging for two ears.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，尋自割耳持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世當得具足無上智耳。』
translation: When I heard that, I rejoiced, cut off my own ear and gave it to him, and after giving it to him, I vowed, 'May I attain the unsurpassed ear of wisdom in the next life.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有尼乾子，名想，復來從我乞索男根。
translation: Not long after that, a young Nirgrantha named Viśiṣṭhila came back to me begging for male faculties.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，尋即自割持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提得馬藏相。』
translation: After hearing this, I was delighted, so I cut myself off and gave it to him, and after giving it to him, I vowed, 'May I attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in the next life and attain the marks of a horse treasure.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，復有人來，從我乞索其身血肉。
translation: Not long after that, another person came to me begging for his flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即便施之，施已發願：『願我來世具足無上金色之相。』
translation: I rejoiced when I heard that, and I gave it to him. After giving it to him, I vowed, 'May I be endowed with the unsurpassed golden features in the next life.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有婆羅門，名曰蜜味，復來從我求索二手。
translation: Not long after that, a Brāhmaṇa named Maitreya came back to me asking for secondhand flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，右手持刀尋斷左手，作如是言：『今此右手不能自割，卿自取之。』
translation: When I heard that, my heart rejoiced, and I held a knife in my right hand and searched for my left hand, saying, 'Now, I can't cut my own right hand, so take it from me.'

source_sentence: 作是施已，復發願言：『願我來世具足當得無上信手。』
translation: After making this offering, he also made a vow, saying, 'May I be perfected in the next life and attain unsurpassed faith in my hand.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我截如是諸支節已，其身血流，復作願言：『因此施故，必定成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，所願成就得己利者，其餘身分重得受者。』
translation: After cutting off these limbs, my blood flowed from my body, and I again made the vow, saying, 'Because of this gift, I will surely achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, and those who accomplish what they desire will obtain their own benefit, while the rest of their status will be heavily recipient.'

source_sentence: 爾時非聖不知思義，諸小王等及諸大臣皆作是言：『咄哉愚人！
translation: At the time, the nonholy ones didn't know the meaning, and the lesser kings and other ministers all said, 'My, foolish!

source_sentence: 如何自割身體支節，令諸自在一旦衰滅，其餘肉摶復何所直？』
translation: How can you cut off your own body limbs so that once your natural abilities perish, what can you do with the rest of your flesh?'

source_sentence: 是時，大臣即持我身，送著城外曠野塚間，各還所止。
translation: The minister then took my body and sent it off to a wilderness tumulus outside the city, where it had been returned to its resting place.

source_sentence: 時有無量蚊虻蠅等唼食我血，狐狼、野干、鵰鷲之屬，悉來噉肉。
translation: Countless mosquitoes, pests, and flies were gobbling my blood, and foxes, wolves, wild animals, and eagles came to devour my flesh.

source_sentence: 我於爾時命未斷間，心生歡喜，復作願言：『如我捨於一切自在及諸支節，乃至一念不生瞋恚及悔恨心，若我所願成就得己利者，當令此身，作大肉山，有諸飲血噉肉眾生，悉來至此，隨意飲噉。』
translation: Before my life was cut short, I rejoiced at heart and again made the vow, saying, 'If I were to abandon all my abilities and limbs, even to the point of not becoming angry or remorseful in one thought, then if I were to achieve what I want for my own benefit, I would make this body into a great mountain of flesh, where all the sentient beings who drink blood and eat flesh would come and eat it as they like.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，尋有眾生悉來食噉，本願力故，其身轉大高千由旬，縱廣正等五百由旬。
translation: After making this vow, I'll find all the sentient beings who come to eat it, and as a result of the power of this vow, my body will grow a thousand leagues tall and exactly 500 leagues wide.

source_sentence: 滿千歲中，以此血肉給施眾生。
translation: For a thousand years, he would give this flesh and blood to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我於爾時所捨舌根，令諸虎狼、鵄梟、鵰鷲食之飽足，以願力故，復生如本，假當聚集如耆闍崛山，作是施已，復作是願：『願我來世具足得成廣長舌相。』
translation: At the time, I gave up my tongue to feed tigers, wolves, owls, and eagles, and because of the power of my vow, it was again produced like the original, which would have gathered like Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa. After making this gift, I then made this vow: 'May I fully attain a broad and long tongue in a future life.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我時命終在閻浮提，以本願故，生於龍中，作大龍王，名示現寶藏，即於生夜，示現百千億那由他種種寶藏，自宣令言：『今是分中，多有寶藏，其中具足諸珍異物，金銀乃至摩尼寶珠。』
translation: When my life ended in Jambudvīpa, I was born among dragons because of my original vow to become a great dragon king named Revealing the Treasure Trove, and during the night of my birth, I revealed a hundred trillion nayutas of various treasures and declared to myself, 'Now, in this part of the world, there are many treasures that are filled with rare and precious things, from gold and silver to the precious jewel of a maṇi.'

source_sentence: 是諸眾生聞是唱已，各各自恣取諸寶物隨意所用。
translation: After hearing this announcement, the sentient beings each freely take these treasures and use them as they like.

source_sentence: 用已具足行十善道，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，或發聲聞辟支佛心。
translation: Once they had used them, they did the ten good deeds and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, or the mind of śrāvakas and solitary buddhas.

source_sentence: 我於爾時在龍王中，七返受身，壽命七萬七千億那由他百千歲，示現無量無邊阿僧祇寶藏，與諸眾生。
translation: At the time, I was among the dragon kings, reborn seven times, enjoying a body with a lifespan of 7,700,000,000,000 nayutas and 1,000,000 years, and I showed them a treasure trove of incalculable, unlimited, incalculable treasures to share with sentient beings.

source_sentence: 爾時安住無量無邊阿僧祇人於三乘中，勸令具足行十善道，以種種無量珍寶滿眾生已，復發願言：『願我來世具足，當得三十二相。』
translation: At the time, he was staying among the three vehicles, encouraging people of measureless and unlimited incalculability to fully practice the ten good paths, and after filling sentient beings with various and immeasurable treasures, he also made the vow, saying, 'May I be perfected in the next life and will attain the thirty-two marks.'

source_sentence: 如是第二天下，亦復七生作大龍王，乃至遍滿選擇世界在在處處諸四天下，悉作如是無量利益。
translation: Thus, on the next day, he'll be reborn seven more times as a great dragon king and will pervade the four worlds and everywhere in between to provide measureless benefits like these.

source_sentence: 乃至十方無量無邊無佛世界，一一佛界一一天下，亦復七生作大龍王，壽命七萬七千億那由他百千歲，示現如是無量無邊阿僧祇寶藏，亦復如是。
translation: Even in measureless, limitless, and Buddhaless worlds in the ten directions, under each Buddha-realm and under each world, there are seven more births as great dragon kings with a lifespan of 7,700,000,000,000 nayutas and 1,000,000 years, and they display such a treasure house of incalculable, limitless, and incalculable treasures, just like that.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今當知，是謂如來為菩薩時，深重精進求三十二相之因緣也。
translation: You should now know that this is the cause and condition for the Tathāgata's profound and diligent pursuit of the thirty-two marks when he was a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 如來為菩薩時，所行精進除上八人，過去世中更無能及。
translation: When the Tathāgata was a bodhisattva, the effort he exerted was unsurpassed by the eight people above him, and there's nothing that could have matched it in a past life.

source_sentence: 若過去無者，當知未來諸菩薩等，亦復不能如是勤行深重精進如我所行。
translation: If there were none in the past, you should know that future bodhisattvas and others won't be able to thus diligently conduct profound exertion like what I've done.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 復過無量無邊阿僧祇劫，此界轉名珊瑚池，劫名華手，是時無佛，其世五濁。
translation: After another incalculably long incalculably long eon, this world becomes known as a coral pond, and the eon is called a flower hand, when there's no Buddha and its world is five times defiled.

source_sentence: 我於是中作釋提桓因，名善日光明，觀閻浮提，見諸眾生轉行惡法，我時即化為夜叉像，其形可畏，下閻浮提住諸人前。
translation: When I became Śakra Devānām-Indra, known as the Light of the Good Sun, and looked out over Jambudvīpa and saw all the sentient beings who were engaged in bad behavior, I transformed into an image of a nightshade with a fearsome shape and descended into Jambudvīpa to stay in front of the people.

source_sentence: 諸人見我皆生怖畏，而問我言：『欲何所須？
translation: Those people who saw me became frightened and asked me, 'What do you want?'

source_sentence: 願速說之。』
translation: Please explain this quickly.'

source_sentence: 我時答言：『唯須飲食，更無所須。』
translation: I then answered, 'I only need food and drink, nothing more.'

source_sentence: 其人復問：『欲食何等？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'What kind of food do you want?'

source_sentence: 我復答言：『唯殺於人，噉其血肉。
translation: I then replied, 'Only kill people and eat their flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 汝等若能盡其形壽持不殺戒，乃至正見，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，若發聲聞、緣覺心者，我即不復食噉汝等。』
translation: If you can use up your lifetimes to observe the precept against killing, up to right view, and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, or if you arouse the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, then I won't eat and gnaw on you anymore.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時常作化人，以供食飲。
translation: At the time, I was always working as a transformation agent, providing food and drink.

source_sentence: 爾時眾生見我如是，倍生怖畏，悉皆盡形受不殺戒，乃至正見，或發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，或發聲聞、辟支佛心。
translation: Seeing me like this, sentient beings become doubly frightened, and they all become fully formed, accept the precept against killing, and attain right view, or they may arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct bodhi, or the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 我勸如是閻浮提內一切眾生，修行十善住三乘已，復作誓願：『若我必成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，所願成就得己利者，復當勸此四天下人令行十善道，乃至遍滿此之世界，在在處處四天下中，以如是相貌，令諸眾生行十善道，勸化發於三乘之心。
translation: After I had encouraged all the sentient beings in Jambudvīpa to cultivate the ten good qualities and abide in the three vehicles, I also made a vow, 'If I were certain to achieve unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and attain my own benefit as a result of my vow, I would again encourage the people of these four worlds to practice the ten good paths, even if I were to pervade this world and go around the four worlds in such a way that sentient beings would practice the ten good paths and be encouraged to arouse the mind of the three vehicles.'

source_sentence: 如是遍滿一世界已，乃至十方無量無邊阿僧祇等五濁惡世，無佛國土，亦復如是。』
translation: After thus pervading one world, it will be likewise in measureless, limitless, incalculable, five turbid, and unwholesome worlds and lands without buddhas in the ten directions.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時發是願已，一切成就，於珊瑚池世界化作可畏夜叉之像，調伏眾生，令住十善及三乘中。
translation: After I made this vow and had everything accomplished, I created a fearsome image of a nightingale in the Coral Pond world to subdue sentient beings and make them abide in the ten good qualities and the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 如是遍於十方無量無邊阿僧祇等五濁惡世，無佛國土，作夜叉像，調伏眾生，令行十善，住三乘中。
translation: Thus, I've traveled throughout the measureless, limitless five turbid bad worlds and no buddha land in the ten directions, creating images of yakṣas to tame sentient beings and make them practice the ten good qualities and abide in the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 我於往昔恐怖眾生，令行十善，住三乘中，以是業因緣故，今得坐於菩提樹下，欲成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提時，天魔波旬與諸大眾，來至我所，欲得壞亂我菩提道。
translation: In the past, I terrorized sentient beings, caused them to practice the ten good qualities and abide in the three vehicles, and as a result of that activity, I was sitting under the bodhi tree now, about to achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, when Māra Pāpīyān and the masses came to me, intending to disrupt my path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

translation: "It's briefly explained that when I was a bodhisattva, I was a perfection of giving.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 諸大菩薩甚深法忍，微妙總持，解脫三昧，我於爾時悉未得之，唯除二身有漏五通。
translation: At the time, I hadn't attained any of the great bodhisattvas' profound tolerance of the Dharma, subtle mastery, or liberating samādhi, except for the two bodies and the contaminated five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 我於爾時作此大事，令無量無邊阿僧祇人安止住於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，無量無邊阿僧祇人安止住於辟支佛乘，無量無邊阿僧祇人安止住於聲聞乘中，況復兼得供養諸佛，如一佛世界微塵數等，一一佛邊所得功德，數如大海諸水渧等，供養無量聲聞、緣覺、師長、父母、五通神仙，亦復如是。
translation: At the time, I did this great work to enable measureless and limitless incalculable people to stand still in the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, measureless and limitless incalculable people to stand still in the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and measureless and limitless incalculable people to stand still in the śrāvaka vehicle, not to mention making offerings to buddhas as numerous as the number of dust motes in a single buddha's world and the amount of merit attained by each buddha's side as numerous as the drops of water in the ocean, and making offerings to measureless śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, teachers, parents, and the five supernormal celestials, likewise.

source_sentence: 如我昔者，為菩薩時，自以血肉供給眾生，如是大悲，今諸羅漢，悉無是心。」
translation: Just as in the past when I was a bodhisattva, I offered my own flesh and blood to sentient beings with such great compassion, but none of the arhats today have such a mind."

source_sentence: 悲華經入定三昧門品第六
translation: Compassionate Flower Sutra: The Sixth Chapter of the Samādhi Gate of Entering Concentration

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告寂意菩薩摩訶薩言：「善男子！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva of Silent Meaning, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 如我今者，以佛眼見十方世界，如一佛土微塵等諸佛世尊般涅槃者，皆悉是我昔所勸化初發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，行檀波羅蜜，乃至般若波羅蜜者，未來之世亦復如是。
translation: "Now, I see with the Buddha's eye that the worlds in the ten directions are like a dusting of Buddha-lands and so forth, and that the world-honored ones who attain parinirvāṇa are all those whom I've encouraged to first arouse the mind of unsurpassed, corrected, and perfect enlightenment in the past and will be likewise in future generations.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我今見此東方世界無量無邊阿僧祇等諸佛世尊，今現在世轉正法輪，亦是我昔初勸令發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，行六波羅蜜者。
translation: Now, I see this world of the east endless and limitless incalculable buddhas, the world-honored ones, now in the world turning the right wheel of the Dharma, the same ones I first urged to give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and to practice the six perfections.

source_sentence: 南西北方四維上下，亦復如是。
translation: The same goes for the four counterpoints up and down in the south, west, and north.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 東方去此八十九億諸佛世界，彼有世界名曰善華，是中有佛，號無垢功德光明王如來、應、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，今現在為眾生說法。
translation: In the east, there's a world of 8.9 billion buddhas named Sunflower, and there's a buddha there named Tathāgata, King of Immaculate Merit, Worthy, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One, who now speaks to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 彼佛亦是我昔所勸初發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，令行檀波羅蜜，乃至般若波羅蜜。
translation: That Buddha is also the one whom I once encouraged to first give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and to practice the perfection of giving and the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 東方復有妙樂世界，是中有佛號阿閦如來。
translation: In the east, there's another world of marvelous bliss, in which there's a Buddha named Akṣobhya Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有閻浮世界，是中有佛，號日藏如來。
translation: Again, there's the Jambudvīpa world, in which there's a Buddha named Sun-Store Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名樂自在，是中有佛，號樂自在音光明如來。
translation: Again, there's a world named Bliss Freely, and in it there's a Buddha named Bliss Freely Sound Illuminating Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名曰安樂，是中有佛，號智日如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Anāthapiṇḍada, and in it there's a Buddha named Jñānacandra Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名勝功德，是中有佛，號龍自在如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Superbly Meritorious, and in it there's a Buddha named Dragon Freely Radiant Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名善相，是中有佛，號金剛稱如來。
translation: There's another world named Sunshine, and in it there's a Buddha named Vajragarbha Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名江海王，是中有佛，號光明如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named River King, and in it there's a Buddha named Radiant Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名不愛樂，是中有佛，號日藏如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Unattached, and there's a Buddha in it called the Sun-Store Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名離垢光明，是中有佛，號自在稱如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Light Absorption, and there's a Buddha in it named the Tathāgata of Freely Renown.

source_sentence: 復有世界名山光明，是中有佛，號不可思議王如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Mountain Light, and in it there's a Buddha named Inconceivable King Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名聚集，是中有佛，號大功德藏如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Gathering, and in it is a Buddha named the Tathāgata of the Great Treasury of Merit.

source_sentence: 復有世界名華光明，是中有佛，號光明意相如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Flower Light, and in it is a Buddha named Bright-minded Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有世界名和熾盛，是中有佛，號安和自在見山王如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Harmoniously Teeming, and in it there's a Buddha named Tathāgata King of Mountains of Tranquility and Freedom of Vision.

source_sentence: 復有世界名善地，是中有佛，號知像如來。
translation: "Again, there's a world named Shandi, and in it there's a Buddha named Tathāgata Who Knows Images.

source_sentence: 復有世界名曰華晝，是中有佛，號眼淨無垢如來。
translation: There's another world named Pārijāta, and in it there's a Buddha who's called the Tathāgata of Pure and Immaculate Eyes.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如是東方無量無邊阿僧祇等現在諸佛，為諸眾生轉法輪者，未發無上菩提心時，我初勸其令發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，又復引導將至十方在在處處佛世尊所，隨所至處，修行安止檀波羅蜜，乃至般若波羅蜜，使得授阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。」
translation: Thus, in the east, when measureless, limitless, incalculable, and numerous buddhas are now turning the Dharma wheel for sentient beings who have yet to develop the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment, I first encouraged them to develop the mind of unsurpassed, corrected, and guided them to visit the Bhagavān's abodes in all directions, cultivate the peaceful practice of the perfection of giving and the perfection of wisdom, and cause them to grant the assurance of unsurpassed, corrected, and complete enlightenment."

source_sentence: 爾時，東方善華世界無垢功德光明王佛，師子之座及其大地，六種震動，有大光明，雨於種種妙寶蓮華。
translation: At the time, the lion-seat of the lion's son and his earth were shaken by six kinds of light that rained down on a variety of marvelously jeweled lotus flowers.

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩見是事已，心生驚疑怪未曾有，即白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the bodhisattvas were startled and doubted it as unprecedented, and they said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故，如來之座如是震動？
translation: What causes the Tathāgata's throne to shake like this?

source_sentence: 我等昔來未曾見是。」
translation: We've never seen anything like this in the past."

source_sentence: 其佛即告諸菩薩言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha then addressed the bodhisattvas, saying, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 西方去此八十九億諸佛世界，彼有國土名曰娑婆，是中有佛號釋迦牟尼如來，今現在為四部眾說本緣法。
translation: In the eighty-nine billion buddha-worlds to the west, there's a land called Sāva, and there's a Buddha named Śākyamuni Tathāgata who's presently teaching the original conditions for four groups of people.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊為菩薩時，初勸化我發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，復引導我至諸佛所，初令我行檀波羅蜜，乃至般若波羅蜜。
translation: When that Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he first encouraged me to give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, corrected me to go to the buddhas, and first caused me to practice the perfection of giving and the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，隨所至處，即得初受阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。
translation: At that point, wherever I went, I was able to first receive the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊釋迦牟尼，即是我之真善知識，今在西方處在大眾，為諸四部說本緣經。
translation: That Buddha, the World Honored Śākyamuni, who is my true and good teacher, is now in the West, in the midst of the great multitude, teaching the four divisions of the Original Conditions sūtra.

source_sentence: 是彼如來神足力故，令我所坐師子座動。
translation: It was the Tathāgata's miraculous powers that caused the lion's seat I was sitting on to move.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝等今者誰能至彼娑婆世界，問訊彼佛起居輕利？」
translation: Who among you can go to that sahā world today and ask about the relative merits of the Buddha's appearance and abode?"

source_sentence: 時諸菩薩各白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The bodhisattvas then each said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此善華世界諸菩薩等皆得神通，於諸菩薩功德自在，今日清旦見是大光，其光悉從諸佛世界來至於此，大地時時六種震動，雨種種華，見是事已，有無量百千萬億諸菩薩等，欲以神力往娑婆世界見釋迦牟尼佛，供養、恭敬、尊重、讚歎，并欲諮受解了一切陀羅尼門。
translation: In this Saṃbha world, all the bodhisattvas and others have attained supernormal powers, and they have full mastery over the bodhisattvas' virtues. Today, on sunrise, they see this great light, which comes from all the buddha worlds and reaches them.

source_sentence: 然各不知娑婆世界釋迦牟尼所在方面。」
translation: However, each of them didn't know where Śākyamuni was in the Saha world."

source_sentence: 彼佛尋伸金色右臂，於五指頭放於種種微妙光明，其光即照八十九億諸佛國土至娑婆世界。
translation: The Buddha then extended his golden right arm and radiated a variety of subtle lights from the tips of his five fingers, which immediately shone in 8.9 billion buddha lands up to the Saṃbha world.

source_sentence: 時諸菩薩因光得見娑婆世界，有諸菩薩摩訶薩等充滿側塞，復有諸天龍神、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽等滿虛空中。
translation: As a result of that light, the bodhisattvas were able to see the Śākya World, which was filled with bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others, as well as gods, dragons, gods, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, and others filling the sky.

source_sentence: 見是事已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After he saw this, he said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今已得見彼世界，知其方面，并見菩薩諸天大眾，彌滿其土間無空處，釋迦如來不觀我等說微妙法。」
translation: Now, I've been able to see that world, know its aspects, and see a great multitude of bodhisattvas and gods that fill it with no empty space, and the Śākyamuni Tathāgata doesn't observe us as he explains the subtle Dharma."

source_sentence: 彼佛告諸菩薩大士：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 釋迦如來恒以清淨無上佛眼，遍觀一切，無不見者。
translation: The Śākyamuni Tathāgata always observes everything with the pure, unsurpassed Buddha eye, and there's no one he doesn't see.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 娑婆世界所有眾生在地處空，一一皆言：『釋迦如來獨觀我心，為我說法。』
translation: All the sentient beings in the Saha world who are on the ground and in space say, 'The Śākyamuni Tathāgata alone observes my mind and speaks for me.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 彼釋迦如來以一音聲，為諸種種異類說法，眾生各各隨類得解，非以異音為多人說。
translation: That Śākyamuni Tathāgata speaks with a single voice to a variety of different kinds of people, and sentient beings understand each according to its type, not by speaking to many people with different voices.

source_sentence: 彼土眾生，或事梵天，見如來身為梵天像而得聞法；若事魔天、釋天、日月、毘沙門天、毘樓羅叉、毘樓博叉、提頭賴吒、摩醯首羅，如是種類八萬四千，隨其所事，各見其像而得聞法，生獨為想。」
translation: Whether they serve the Brahma gods and see the Tathāgata's body in the image of a Brahma god, or they serve the Māra gods, Śākyamuni gods, Sun and Moon gods, Vaiśravaṇa gods, Virūḍhaka, Virūpākṣa, Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Mahêśvara, or 84,000 of these kinds of beings, each sees their own image and gets to hear the Dharma, giving rise to the notion of being independent."

source_sentence: 是時，會中有二菩薩，一名羅睺電，二名火光明。
translation: At the time, there were two bodhisattvas in the assembly, one Rāhu-deva and the other named Fiery Radiance.

source_sentence: 爾時無垢功德光明王佛告二菩薩：「善男子！
translation: It was then that the Buddha, the King of Immaculate Merit and Luminosity, addressed the two bodhisattvas, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今可往娑婆世界，汝持我聲，問訊釋迦牟尼世尊：『起居輕利，氣力安不？』」
translation: Now, you may go to the Śākyamuni world and hold my voice as you ask the Bhagavān, 'Does he live lightly and has his energy been restored?'"

source_sentence: 時二菩薩即白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The two bodhisattvas then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見彼佛一切世界，大眾雲集，在地、虛空充滿側塞，其間無有空缺之處。
translation: I've seen all of that Buddha's worlds, with their masses gathered together, the earth and space filled with obstructions, and no vacant place between them.

source_sentence: 若我等往，當住何處？」
translation: If we go there, where will we stay?"

source_sentence: 時佛告言：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha then addressed them, saying, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 莫作是語，言彼世界無止住處。
translation: Don't say this, saying that there's no place to stop in that world.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼所住處，寬博無邊，彼佛所有無量功德不可思議，以本願故，悲心廣大，乃令無量諸眾生類入於佛法受三歸依，然後為說三乘之法，復說三戒、示三脫門，復拔無量無邊眾生於三惡道，安止令住三善道中。
translation: That place is vast and limitless, and that Buddha's measureless merits are unfathomable. Because of his original vow, his compassion is so vast that he causes measureless sentient beings to enter the Buddha's teaching and accept the three refuges, then he teaches the Dharma of the three vehicles, furthermore teaches the three precepts, shows the three gates of liberation, and removes measureless and limitless sentient beings from the three bad destinies and stabilizes them in the three good destinies.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 又一時中，釋迦如來成無上道未久之間，為欲調伏諸眾生故，在毘陀山因臺娑羅窟，七日七夜結加趺坐，三昧正受入解脫樂，佛身爾時遍滿是窟間無空處乃至四寸。
translation: At another time, not long after the Tathāgata had achieved the unsurpassed way, in order to tame sentient beings, he sat cross-legged in the Indaisala cave on Mount Veda for seven days and nights, concentrating and feeling correctly, and entering the bliss of liberation, when the Buddha's body filled the cave without an empty space up to four inches.

source_sentence: 過七日已，十方世界有十二那由他菩薩摩訶薩，至娑婆世界住其山邊，欲見釋迦牟尼如來，供養、恭敬、尊重、讚歎，啟受妙法。
translation: After seven days had passed, twelve nayutas, bodhisattvas, and mahāsattvas from the worlds of the ten directions went to live on the edge of that mountain in the Saha world, wanting to meet the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, make offerings, revere, respect, praise, and reveal the wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時如來於所住處，以大神足，令其窟舍寬博無量，悉得容受十二那由他菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata used his great supernormal powers to make his cave dwelling so vast and immeasurable that it could accommodate 12 bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas who were nayutas.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩等既得入已，見其窟舍廣博嚴事，有諸菩薩，以師子遊戲自在神足供養於佛，一一菩薩於化寶座而坐聽法。
translation: After they had gained entry, the bodhisattvas saw the vast expanse and splendor of their cave, and there were bodhisattvas who made offerings to the Buddha with the miraculous powers of lion play, each sitting on a transformation jewel throne and listening to the teaching.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 彼佛神力其事如是。
translation: Such is the case with that Buddha's supernormal power.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩得聞法已，尋從坐起，頭面禮佛，右遶三匝，各各還歸本佛世界。
translation: After they heard the teaching, the bodhisattvas then rose from their seats, bowed their heads to the Buddha, circled him three times to his right, and returned to their original buddha-realm.

source_sentence: 其去未久，窟還如故。
translation: They didn't leave for long, but the cave returned as before.

source_sentence: 「彼四天下第二天主，釋提桓因名憍尸迦，其命將終必定當墮畜生道中，以是事故，心生恐懼，與八萬四千諸忉利天俱共來下，詣因娑羅窟欲見如來。
translation: "On the second day of the four worlds, the god Śakra Devānām-Indra, named Śāriputra, was so afraid that he would surely end up in the animal kingdom that he came down with 84,000 other Heavenly Dignāga gods to the cave of Insāra to see the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時有夜叉名曰王眼，即其窟神在外而住。
translation: At the time, there was a night flying creature named Wang-Eye, who was the god of the cave and was staying outside.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋以佛力故，作是思惟：『今我當使乾闥婆子般遮旬，先至佛所，以妙音聲讚詠如來，當令世尊，從三昧起。』
translation: Because of the Buddha's power, Indra then thought, 'Now, I will have the son of Gandharva, Pancakra, go to the Buddha first and praise the Tathāgata with a wonderful voice that will cause the Bhagavān to arise from samādhi.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 釋提桓因思惟是已，即令乾闥婆子般遮旬，彈琉璃琴，以微妙音，其音別異有五百種，以讚如來。
translation: After Śakrodevānī thought about this, he had the gandharva Pāñcika play the beryl lute with a marvelous sound that had five hundred distinctive sounds to praise the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 是般遮旬當讚佛時，爾時如來即復轉入相三昧中，以三昧力故，於此世界作大神力，令諸夜叉、羅剎、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、欲色界天，悉來聚集其中。

translation: When the Tathāgata returned to his divine feet, the masses each regained their original views and each said, "Where is the Tathāgata now?"

source_sentence: 爾時，彌勒菩薩告諸大眾：「汝等當知，我今與汝等，悉在如來身分之中。」
translation: It was then that Maitreya addressed the crowd, "You should know that I and you are all here in the Tathāgata's body."

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾即見如來身之內外，尋自覺知與無量大眾集聚，共處如來身中，復相謂言：「我等為從何處得入？
translation: At that point, the masses then saw the Tathāgata's body inside and out, and they realized on their own that they were gathered with measureless multitudes of people who were all together in the Tathāgata's body, and they said to each other, "Where did we get in?

source_sentence: 誰將導我令入是中？」
translation: Who will guide me into this?"

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩復告之曰：「諦聽！
translation: Maitreya again told him, "Listen closely!

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen closely!

source_sentence: 如來今者現大神通變化之力，復為利益我等大眾將欲說法，仁等今當一心專念。」
translation: Now, the Tathāgata is displaying great supernormal powers of transformation, and he's about to preach for the benefit of our great crowd, so you, my friends, should focus your minds on that."

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾聞是語已，長跪合掌，受教而聽。
translation: After hearing those words, the whole crowd knelt down and joined their palms, accepting the teaching and listening.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以一切行門而演說法：「何等名為一切行門？
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān explained the teaching using the approach of all practices, "What's called the approach of all practices?

source_sentence: 出生死淤泥，入八聖道，具足成就得一切智。
translation: They emerge from the muck of birth and death, enter the eightfold noble path, and fully accomplish the attainment of omniscience.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 有十專心發於菩提，能入是門。
translation: There are ten dedicated mental states of mind that engender bodhi and enable one to enter this gate.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 一者欲令眾生悉得解脫，迴向隨喜故；二者發大悲心攝眾生故；三者欲度未度，精勤修治無上法船故；四者欲解未解者莊嚴，觀脫於虛妄顛倒故；五者欲師子吼無所怖畏莊嚴，觀於諸法性無我故；六者欲隨所到一切世界心無分別，善學諸法，同十喻故；七者欲得光明莊嚴世界，修治戒聚，令清淨故；八者成就莊嚴如來十力，具足一切波羅蜜故；九者成就莊嚴四無所畏，如說而作故；十者莊嚴十八不共之法，隨所聞法悉得無餘，不放逸故。
translation: 一者欲令眾生悉得解脫，迴向隨喜故；二者發大悲心攝眾生故；三者欲度未度，精勤修治無上法船故；四者欲解未解者莊嚴，觀脫於虛妄顛倒故；五者欲師子吼無所怖畏莊嚴，觀於諸法性無我故；六者欲隨所到一切世界心無分別，善學諸法，同十喻故；七者欲得光明莊嚴世界，修治戒聚，令清淨故；八者成就莊嚴如來十力，具足一切波羅蜜故；九者成就莊嚴四無所畏，如說而作故；十者莊嚴十八不共之法，隨所聞法悉得無餘，不放逸故。

source_sentence: 是名十法專心，發於無上菩提，則能入是一切行門，即得不退無上菩提、無相行門、智道行門，一切法無我心、無思惟，不生不滅，是名菩薩不退轉地。
translation: These are called the ten concentrations of mind, and when they are given rise to unsurpassed bodhi, then they can enter all these practices, which are the stage of nonretrogression, unsurpassed bodhi, the practice of formlessness, and the practice of the path of wisdom, where all things lack self-mind and contemplation and don't arise or cease, which is called the bodhisattva's stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 以是故，非退非不退，非斷非常，非定非亂。」
translation: Because of this, it's neither retrogressive nor nonretrogressive, neither cut off nor undefiled, and neither determined nor disturbed."

source_sentence: 說是法時，如來腹內八十億恒河沙等菩薩摩訶薩，得不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，不可數菩薩摩訶薩得諸三昧甚深法忍，悉從如來身毛孔出，心大驚怪，歎未曾有。
translation: When he spoke this teaching, the 8 billion rhesus sands of bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas inside the Tathāgata's belly attained irreversibility and unsurpassed supreme enlightenment, and an incalculable number of bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas attained samādhi and profound Dharma tolerance, all of which came out of the Tathāgata's pores, were greatly surprised and admired as unprecedented.

source_sentence: 即於佛前，頭面著地，為佛作禮，起已忽然各還十方本佛世界，復聞釋迦牟尼如來所演音聲，過十方無量無邊阿僧祇等諸佛世界，無諸障閡。
translation: They then bowed to the Buddha with their heads on the ground, and after rising, they each suddenly returned to their original Buddha-realm in the ten directions and heard the voice of Śākyamuni the Tathāgata emitting sound that passed through measureless, unlimited, incalculable, and numerous Buddha-realms in the ten directions, with no obstructions.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩雖還彼界，續聞如來所演音教，章句義味無所減少，如在佛前，近聽無異。
translation: Even though they returned to that realm, these bodhisattvas continued to hear the Tathāgata's voice and teachings, the meaning and flavor of which were not diminished, as if they were in the Buddha's presence and heard nothing different up close.

source_sentence: 身亦如是，遍諸十方無量世界。
translation: Their bodies are likewise spread throughout measureless worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 亦有無量無邊阿僧祇菩薩、聲聞，亦見毛孔出入無礙。
translation: There are also measureless and limitless incalculably numerous bodhisattvas and śrāvakas who also see pores that flow in and out without obstruction.

source_sentence: 如是第二，乃至一切一一毛孔出入無礙，十方世界亦如是。
translation: Thus, second, up to each and every pore that exits and enters without obstruction, the worlds in the ten directions are likewise.

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾從釋迦如來毛孔中出，頭面禮佛，右繞三匝，住於佛前，以種種音聲而讚歎佛。
translation: At the time, the whole crowd emerged from the pores of the Śākyamuni Tathāgata, bowed their heads to the Buddha, circled him three times to his right, and stayed in front of him, praising him with a variety of sounds.

source_sentence: 爾時，欲界、色界諸天，雨種種華、塗香、末香、幢幡、瓔珞，微妙技樂供養如來。
translation: At the time, the gods of the desire realm and form realm rained down various flowers, perfumes, incense, banners, streamers, and jewelry, and offered subtle feats of joy to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時，會中有一菩薩名無畏等地，長跪叉手，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, there was a bodhisattva in the assembly named Fearless and Equal Ground who knelt down and saluted the Buddha with his palms together, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是大經當名何等？
translation: What should be the name of such a great scripture?

source_sentence: 云何奉持？」
translation: How do you uphold it?"

source_sentence: 佛告無畏等地菩薩：「是經當名『解了一切陀羅尼門』，亦名『無量佛』，亦名『大眾』，亦名『授菩薩記』，亦名『四無所畏出現於世』，亦名『一切諸三昧門』，亦名『示現諸佛世界』，亦名『猶如大海』，亦名『無量』，亦名『大悲蓮華』。」
translation: The Buddha told the fearless equipoise bodhisattva, "This sūtra will be called 'The Dhāraṇī Gate of Understanding All Things,' 'It's also called 'Measureless Buddhas,' 'The Great Multitude,' 'The Granting of the Bodhisattva's Record,' 'The Four Fearless Appearances in the World,' 'The Gate of All Samādhis,' 'The Manifestation of the Buddha-Worlds,' 'Just Like the Ocean,' 'Measureless,' and 'The Greatly Compassionate Lotus.'"

source_sentence: 無畏等地菩薩摩訶薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Again, the fearless, equipoised bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，受持是經，讀誦通利，為他人說，乃至一偈，得幾所福？」
translation: If a good man or woman memorizes this sūtra, recites it fluently, and teaches it for others, even in a single verse, how much merit will it obtain?"

source_sentence: 佛告無畏等地菩薩：「我已先說所得福德，今當為汝更略說之。
translation: The Buddha told the fearless bodhisattvas of the equipoise stage, "I've already explained the merit I've gained, so now I'll explain it more briefly for you.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人若有受持是經，讀誦通利，為他人說，乃至一偈，於後五十歲中，乃至有能書寫一偈，所得功德勝諸菩薩十大劫中行六波羅蜜。
translation: Good sons and good women who accept this sūtra, recite it fluently, and speak it for others, even down to a single verse, and who are able to write a single verse in the next 50 years, will attain more merit than the six perfections practiced by other bodhisattvas in 10 eons.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸天魔、梵、沙門、婆羅門、夜叉、羅剎、龍、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、拘辦荼、餓鬼、毘舍遮、人及非人，有瞋恚心者，聞是經已，即得清淨、柔軟、歡喜，而離諸病、忿怒、怨賊，種種鬪諍，消滅一切暴風惡雨，病者得愈，飢渴者得飽滿，受諸快樂，和合相順。
translation: "When gods, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, priests, yakṣas, rāzas, dragons, gandharvas, asuras, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, kuṇḍas, hungry ghosts, piśācīs, humans, and nonhumans with anger hear this sūtra, they become pure, gentle, and joyous, part with illness, anger, resentment, and enemies, and various kinds of quarrels, quell all violent storms, heal the sick, fill hunger and thirst, experience pleasure, and harmonize with each other.

source_sentence: 瞋恚之者，能令忍辱。
translation: Those who are angry will be able to tolerate it.

source_sentence: 怖畏者無所畏怖，受諸歡樂。
translation: Those who are afraid are made fearless, and they experience joy.

source_sentence: 有煩惱者令離煩惱，能令善根一切增長，能拔惡道所有眾生，能示三乘出要之路，能得甚深法忍三昧陀羅尼門，能與眾生作大利益，能坐道場金剛之座，能破四魔，能示一切助菩提法，能轉法輪。
translation: Those who have afflictions are freed from them, made to develop all their good roots, uproot all sentient beings in the evil path, show them the way out of the three vehicles, attain the samādhi-dhāraṇī approach of profound tolerance of phenomena, work with sentient beings for their great benefit, sit on the adamantine seat of the ritual site, dispel the four demons, show them all the methods that aid enlightenment, and turn the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 無聖財者能令具足，能令無量無邊眾生入無畏城。
translation: He can make those without noble possessions complete and cause measureless and limitless sentient beings to enter the city of fearlessness.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，能持此經，讀誦通利，為他人說乃至一偈，若後末世五十歲中，乃至有能書寫一偈，得如是等無量無邊福德之聚。
translation: Because of these reasons, someone who can hold this sūtra, recite it fluently, and speak even a single verse for others, or even someone who can write a single verse in the fifty years of the latter age, will attain such a measureless and limitless stock of merit.

source_sentence: 是故我今說如是經，如是大經當付囑誰？
translation: Therefore, now that I've explained this sūtra, who will I entrust with such a great sūtra?

source_sentence: 誰能於後五十歲中護持是法？
translation: Who can maintain this teaching during the next fifty years?

source_sentence: 誰能與諸在在處處不退菩薩宣說令聞？
translation: Who can explain this to bodhisattvas who are in all places and don't regress so that they'll hear it?

source_sentence: 誰復能為行非法、欲惡、貪邪見、不信善惡，有果報者，演布是教？」
translation: Who else can explain this teaching to someone who practices unlawfulness, desires evil, craves wrong views, and doesn't believe in good and evil, and who has the results?"

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾皆知佛心。
translation: At the time, the whole crowd knew the Buddha's mind.

source_sentence: 於時有一大仙夜叉，名無怨沸宿，坐於眾中。
translation: At the time, there was a great sage named Muktaghosa sitting in the midst of the crowd.

source_sentence: 爾時彌勒菩薩摩訶薩即從坐起，將是夜叉至於佛所。
translation: Maitreya then, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his seat and summoned that yakṣa to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時如來告是夜叉大仙：「汝今當受是經，乃至末後五十歲中，為不退菩薩，乃至不信善惡報者，演布是教。」
translation: The Tathāgata then addressed that great sage, Yakṣa, "Now, you will accept this sūtra until the next 50 years, when you will proclaim this teaching for nonretrogressing bodhisattvas and those who don't believe in the results of good and evil."

source_sentence: 爾時，夜叉即白佛言：「我於過去八十四大劫中，以本願故，作仙夜叉，修行阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，爾時教化無量無邊阿僧祇人，安止於四無量心，復令無量無邊眾生不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: It was then that the night-shark said to the Buddha, "In the 84 great eons of the past, because of my original vow, I became an immortal night-shark and cultivated the unsurpassed, corrected measureless and limitless incalculable people, stabilized them in the four immeasurable states of mind, and caused measureless and limitless sentient beings not to regress to the unsurpassed, corrected, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今當為未來之世一切眾生作擁護故，於後末世五十歲中，受持是經，乃至從他聞四句偈，要當讀誦悉令通利，流布與人，令不斷絕。」
translation: Now, for the sake of upholding all sentient beings in future generations, I will accept this sūtra for fifty years in the latter part of time, even if I hear the four verses from others, will recite them and make them fully accessible, and will disseminate them to others so that they won't be cut off."

source_sentence: 佛說是經已，寂意菩薩、諸天大眾、乾闥婆等、人及非人，皆大歡喜，頭面作禮，退坐而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the Viśeṣa-cinti-bodhisattva, the gods and great multitudes, the gandharvas, and both humans and non-humans rejoiced greatly, paid homage with their heads and faces, withdrew to sit, and departed.

source_sentence: 悲華經卷第十
translation: Compassionate Flower Sutra, Volume 10
